dataSetInformation.common:synonyms: LPG; Autogas; Propane; Butane; Liquid Gas; Cook Gas
LPG; Autogas; Propane; Butane; Liquid Gas; Cook Gas
dataSetInformation.common:generalComment: Liquefied Petroleum Gas (LPG) is a product flow characterized by being a flammable mixture of hydrocarbon gases used as fuel in heating appliances, cooking equipment, and vehicles. It typically contains processing levels involving refining and condensation, adherence to safety and quality standards, and is commonly used as a heating source or automotive fuel. The production involves the separation and collection of gases during natural gas purification or oil refining, with educt names including propane and butane. It can be part of both production and consumption mixes and is available in cylinders or bulk for various sectors like domestic, commercial, and industrial 'to consumer', or 'at plant'.
液化石油气 (LPG) 是一种可燃的碳氢化合物气体混合物，用作加热器具、烹饪设备和车辆的燃料。它通常包括提炼和冷凝的处理水平，符合安全和质量标准，并且常作为加热源或者汽车燃料使用。其生产过程包括在天然气净化或油品精炼过程中分离和收集气体，原料名称包括丙烷和丁烷。它可以是生产和消费混合物的一部分，并且以气瓶或散装的形式为家庭、商业和工业等不同领域提供 '给消费者' 或 '在工厂'。
dataSetInformation.sumFormula: C3H8 for propane and C4H10 for butane (LPG is a mixture of both and potentially other gases, exact composition can vary)
